verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jabin king of Hazor had heard those things, that he sent to Jobab king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,
verses.web: When Jabin king of Hazor heard of it, he sent to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,
verses.ct: When Jabin king of Hazor heard about Israel's victories, he sent word to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,

verses.kjv: And to the kings that were on the north of the mountains, and of the plains south of Chinneroth, and in the valley, and in the borders of Dor on the west,
verses.web: and to the kings who were on the north, in the hill country, in the Arabah south of Chinneroth, in the lowland, and in the heights of Dor on the west,
verses.ct: and to the kings in the northern hill country, in the Jordan Valley south of Chinneroth, in the western foothills, and in the coastal region of Dor to the west.

verses.kjv: And to the Canaanite on the east and on the west, and to the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite in the mountains, and to the Hivite under Hermon in the land of Mizpeh.
verses.web: to the Canaanite on the east and on the west, the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Jebusite in the hill country, and the Hivite under Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
verses.ct: He also sent word to the Canaanites on the east and west, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites in the hill country, and the Hivites living below Mount Hermon in the land of Mizpeh.

verses.kjv: And they went out, they and all their hosts with them, much people, even as the sand that is upon the sea shore in multitude, with horses and chariots very many.
verses.web: They went out, they and all their armies with them, many people, even as the sand that is on the seashore in multitude, with very many horses and chariots.
verses.ct: They marched out with all their armies — a massive force as countless as the sand on the seashore — along with enormous numbers of horses and chariots.

verses.kjv: And when all these kings were met together, they came and pitched together at the waters of Merom, to fight against Israel.
verses.web: All these kings met together; and they came and encamped together at the waters of Merom, to fight with Israel.
verses.ct: All these kings joined forces and set up camp together at the waters of Merom to wage war against Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Be not afraid because of them: for to morrow about this time will I deliver them up all slain before Israel: thou shalt hough their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.
verses.web: LORD said to Joshua, “Don’t be afraid because of them; for tomorrow at this time, I will deliver them up all slain before Israel. You shall hamstring their horses and burn their chariots with fire.”
verses.ct: The LORD told Joshua, "Don't be afraid of them. By this time tomorrow, I will hand them all over to Israel as dead men. You are to hamstring their horses and burn their chariots."

verses.kjv: So Joshua came, and all the people of war with him, against them by the waters of Merom suddenly; and they fell upon them.
verses.web: So Joshua came suddenly, with all the warriors, against them by the waters of Merom, and attacked them.
verses.ct: Joshua and his entire fighting force launched a surprise attack against them at the waters of Merom, charging straight into their ranks.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered them into the hand of Israel, who smote them, and chased them unto great Zidon, and unto Misrephothmaim, and unto the valley of Mizpeh eastward; and they smote them, until they left them none remaining.
verses.web: LORD delivered them into the hand of Israel, and they struck them, and chased them to great Sidon, and to Misrephoth Maim, and to the valley of Mizpah eastward. They struck them until they left them no one remaining.
verses.ct: The LORD handed them over to Israel. The Israelites cut them down and chased the survivors all the way to greater Sidon, to Misrephothmaim, and eastward to the valley of Mizpeh. They kept striking them until not a single one was left alive.

verses.kjv: And Joshua did unto them as the LORD bade him: he houghed their horses, and burnt their chariots with fire.
verses.web: Joshua did to them as LORD told him. He hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots with fire.
verses.ct: Joshua did exactly what the LORD had told him — he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots.

verses.kjv: And Joshua at that time turned back, and took Hazor, and smote the king thereof with the sword: for Hazor beforetime was the head of all those kingdoms.
verses.web: Joshua turned back at that time, and took Hazor, and struck its king with the sword: for Hazor used to be the head of all those kingdoms.
verses.ct: Then Joshua turned back and captured Hazor, killing its king with the sword. Hazor had been the leading city over all those kingdoms.

verses.kjv: And they smote all the souls that were therein with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them: there was not any left to breathe: and he burnt Hazor with fire.
verses.web: They struck all the souls who were in it with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them. There was no one left who breathed. He burned Hazor with fire.
verses.ct: The Israelites put everyone in the city to the sword, completely destroying them. Not a single person was left breathing. Then Joshua burned Hazor to the ground.

verses.kjv: And all the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them, did Joshua take, and smote them with the edge of the sword, and he utterly destroyed them, as Moses the servant of the LORD commanded.
verses.web: Joshua captured all the cities of those kings, with their kings, and he struck them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed them; as Moses the servant of LORD commanded.
verses.ct: Joshua captured all the cities of those kings and killed every one of their rulers with the sword, completely destroying them — just as Moses, the servant of the LORD, had commanded.

verses.kjv: But as for the cities that stood still in their strength, Israel burned none of them, save Hazor only; that did Joshua burn.
verses.web: But as for the cities that stood on their mounds, Israel burned none of them, except Hazor only. Joshua burned that.
verses.ct: However, Israel didn't burn any of the cities built on their mounds, except for Hazor. That was the only one Joshua burned.

verses.kjv: And all the spoil of these cities, and the cattle, the children of Israel took for a prey unto themselves; but every man they smote with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them, neither left they any to breathe.
verses.web: The children of Israel took all the plunder of these cities, with the livestock, as plunder for themselves; but every man they struck with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them. They didn’t leave any who breathed.
verses.ct: The Israelites kept all the plunder and livestock from these cities for themselves, but they killed every person with the sword until no one was left alive. Not a single person was left breathing.

verses.kjv: As the LORD commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua; he left nothing undone of all that the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: As LORD commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua. Joshua did so. He left nothing undone of all that LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: The LORD had given these commands to his servant Moses, Moses had passed them on to Joshua, and Joshua carried them out completely. He left nothing undone of everything the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: So Joshua took all that land, the hills, and all the south country, and all the land of Goshen, and the valley, and the plain, and the mountain of Israel, and the valley of the same;
verses.web: So Joshua captured all that land, the hill country, all the South, all the land of Goshen, the lowland, the Arabah, the hill country of Israel, and the lowland of the same;
verses.ct: So Joshua conquered that entire region — the hill country, the whole Negev, all the land of Goshen, the western foothills, the Jordan Valley, and the hills and lowlands of Israel.

verses.kjv: Even from the mount Halak, that goeth up to Seir, even unto Baalgad in the valley of Lebanon under mount Hermon: and all their kings he took, and smote them, and slew them.
verses.web: from Mount Halak, that goes up to Seir, even to Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon under Mount Hermon. He took all their kings, struck them, and put them to death.
verses.ct: His conquests stretched from Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, all the way to Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon below Mount Hermon. He captured all their kings, struck them down, and killed them.

verses.kjv: Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.
verses.web: Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.
verses.ct: Joshua waged war against all these kings for a long time.

verses.kjv: There was not a city that made peace with the children of Israel, save the Hivites the inhabitants of Gibeon: all other they took in battle.
verses.web: There was not a city that made peace with the children of Israel, except the Hivites, the inhabitants of Gibeon. They took all in battle.
verses.ct: Not a single city made peace with the Israelites except the Hivites living in Gibeon. Every other city was taken by force.

verses.kjv: For it was of the LORD to harden their hearts, that they should come against Israel in battle, that he might destroy them utterly, and that they might have no favour, but that he might destroy them, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.web: For it was of LORD to harden their hearts, to come against Israel in battle, that he might utterly destroy them, that they might have no favor, but that he might destroy them, as LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: It was the LORD himself who hardened their hearts so they would go to war against Israel. His purpose was to completely destroy them without mercy, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And at that time came Joshua, and cut off the Anakims from the mountains, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the mountains of Judah, and from all the mountains of Israel: Joshua destroyed them utterly with their cities.
verses.web: Joshua came at that time, and cut off the Anakim from the hill country, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the hill country of Judah, and from all the hill country of Israel: Joshua utterly destroyed them with their cities.
verses.ct: During that time, Joshua also wiped out the Anakim from the hill country — from Hebron, Debir, Anab, and from all the hills of Judah and Israel. Joshua completely destroyed them along with their cities.

verses.kjv: There was none of the Anakims left in the land of the children of Israel: only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, there remained.
verses.web: There were none of the Anakim left in the land of the children of Israel. Only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, did some remain.
verses.ct: No Anakim were left anywhere in the land of Israel. The only places where some survived were Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.

verses.kjv: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that the LORD said unto Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance unto Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. And the land rested from war.
verses.web: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that LORD spoke to Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance to Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. Then the land had rest from war.
verses.ct: So Joshua took control of the entire land, exactly as the LORD had promised Moses. Joshua then distributed it as an inheritance to Israel, dividing it among the tribes. And the land finally had rest from war.
